tit.e: Nara Park (a municipal park in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)
Nara Park (a municipal park in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 奈良公園（ならこうえん）は、奈良県奈良市の若草山麓に広がる都市公園。
sen.e: Nara Koen (奈良公園) is a municipal park stretching at the foot of Mt. Wakakusa in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Nara Park is a municipal park stretching at the foot of Mt. Wakakusa in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Nara Park is a municipal park stretching at the foot of Mt. Wakakusa in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 国の名勝。
sen.e: It is designated as National Scenic Beauty.
It is designated as National Scenic Beauty.
It is designated as National Scenic Beauty.

sen.j: 太政官布告・太政官達により明治13年（1880年）2月14日開園。
sen.e: Nara Park was opened on February 14, 1880, based on Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi (Proclamation or Decree by the Grand Council of State).
Nara Park was opened on February 14, 1880, based on Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi (Proclamation or Decree by the Grand Council of State).
Nara Park was opened on February 14, 1880, based on Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi (Proclamation or Decree by the Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 大部分が国有地で、奈良県が無償で借用し管理している。
sen.e: Most of the park is a state-owned land, which Nara Prefecture borrows for free and maintains.
Most of the park is a state-owned land, which Nara Prefecture borrows for free and maintains.
Most of the park is a state-owned land, which Nara Prefecture borrows for free and maintains.

sen.j: 都市公園としての正式名称は「奈良県立都市公園 奈良公園」といい、総面積は502ha。
sen.e: The formal name as a municipal park is "Nara Prefectural Park Nara Koen", and its total size is 502 ha.
The formal name as a municipal park is 'Nara Kenritsu Toshi koen Nara Koen' (Nara Prefectural Park, Nara Park, and its total size is 502 hectares.
The formal name as a municipal park is 'Nara Kenritsu Toshi koen Nara Koen' (Nara Prefectural Park, Nara Park, and its total size is 502 hectares.

sen.j: 周辺の興福寺、東大寺、春日大社、奈良国立博物館、なども含めると総面積はおよそ660ha（東西約4km、南北約2km）に及ぶ。
sen.e: The total area including the grounds of nearby Kofuku-ji Temple, Todai-ji Temple, Kasuga-taisha Shrine, Nara National Museum, etc. reaches around 660 ha (about 4 km east and west and about 2 km north and south).

The total area including the grounds of nearby Kofuku-ji Temple, Todai-ji Temple, Kasuga-taisha Shrine, Nara National Museum, and so on, reaches around 660 hectares (about 4 kilometers east and west and about 2 kilometers north and south).

The total area including the grounds of nearby Kofuku-ji Temple, Todai-ji Temple, Kasuga-taisha Shrine, Nara National Museum, and so on, reaches around 660 hectares (about 4 kilometers east and west and about 2 kilometers north and south).

sen.j: 通常はこの周辺社寺を含めたエリアを奈良公園と呼ぶことが多い。
sen.e: Generally speaking, the area including these nearby shrines and temples is often called Nara Koen.
Generally speaking, the area including these nearby shrines and temples is often called Nara Park.
Generally speaking, the area including these nearby shrines and temples is often called Nara Park.

sen.j: 公園内には多くの国宝指定・世界遺産登録物件が点在し、年間を通じて日本国内のみならず外国からも多くの観光客が訪れ、日本を代表する観光地の一つとなっている。
sen.e: The park is dotted with a lot of objects that have been designated the National Treasures or registered the World Heritages, and it is one of the tourist areas representing Japan, which a number of tourists visit from not only the domestic regions of Japan but also foreign countries all the year around.

The park is dotted with a lot of objects that have been designated the National Treasures or registered the World Heritages, and it is one of the tourist areas representing Japan, which a number of tourists visit from not only the domestic regions of Japan but also foreign countries all the year around.

The park is dotted with a lot of objects that have been designated the National Treasures or registered the World Heritages, and it is one of the tourist areas representing Japan, which a number of tourists visit from not only the domestic regions of Japan but also foreign countries all the year around.

sen.j: 奈良の大仏や鹿は国際的にも有名で、奈良観光のメインとなっており、修学旅行生の姿も多く見られる。
sen.e: Nara no Daibutsu (the Great Buddha of Nara) and shika (deer) are famous internationally, too, and are main objects of sightseeing in Nara, so a lot of student are seen to come here on a school trip.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「東大寺盧舎那仏像やシカ」をWeb原稿に合わせて「奈良の大仏や鹿」に読み替えました。
sen.e: The Great Buddha of Nara and deer are famous internationally, too, and are main objects of sightseeing in Nara, so a lot of students are seen to come here on a school trip.
sen.cmt: 原文をウェブに合わせ、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: The Great Buddha of Nara and deer are famous internationally, too, and are main objects of sightseeing in Nara, so a lot of students are seen to come here on a school trip.

sen.j: 東大寺修二会やなら燈花会、正倉院展、春日若宮おん祭など古都ならではの見ごたえのある行事も数多い。
sen.e: A lot of events are held which are worth seeing as those suitable to an ancient capital like Nara, such as Todai-ji Temple Shunie (東大寺修二会) Ceremony, Nara Toka-e (なら燈花会) Festival, Shosoin Ten (正倉院展), Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri (春日若宮おん祭) Festival, etc.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「お水取り」、「正倉院」をWeb原稿に合わせて「東大寺修二会」、「正倉院展」に読み替えました。
sen.e: A lot of events are held which are worth seeing as those suitable to an ancient capital like Nara, such as Shunie (Omizu-tori or Sacred Water-drawing Festival) at Todai-ji Temple, Nara Tokae (Candle festival), Exhibition of Shosoin Treasures, Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri Festival, and so on.
sen.cmt: 原文をウェブに合わせ、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: A lot of events are held which are worth seeing as those suitable to an ancient capital like Nara, such as Shunie (Omizu-tori or Sacred Water-drawing Festival) at Todai-ji Temple, Nara Tokae (Candle festival), Exhibition of Shosoin Treasures, Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri Festival, and so on.

sen.j: 塀・柵・門などがなく入園料も不要なのでどこからでも、いつでも（365日・24時間）散策することができる。
sen.e: There are no walls, no fences, and no gates, and no admission charge is required, so you can take a walk from anywhere and anytime (24 hours, 365 days).
There are no walls, fences, nor gates, etc., and admission is free, so you can take a walk from anywhere and anytime (24 hours, 365 days).
There are no walls, fences, nor gates, etc., and admission is free, so you can take a walk from anywhere and anytime (24 hours, 365 days).

sen.j: なお、旧「史蹟名勝天然紀念物保存法」に基づく名称は「名勝奈良公園」である。
sen.e: By the way, the name under the former "Law for the Historic Site, Places of Scenic Beauty and Natural Monuments" is "Meisho Nara Koen" (名勝奈良公園, Place of Scenic Beauty Nara Park).
Additionally, the name under the former 'Law for the Historic Site, Places of Scenic Beauty and Natural Monuments' is 'Meisho Nara Koen' (Place of Scenic Beauty Nara Park).
Additionally, the name under the former 'Law for the Historic Site, Places of Scenic Beauty and Natural Monuments' is 'Meisho Nara Koen' (Place of Scenic Beauty Nara Park).

sen.j: 太字は世界遺産。
sen.e: Those written in bold letters are the World Heritages.
Those written in bold letters are the World Heritages.
Those written in bold letters are the World Heritages.

sen.j: 公園内の大部分は芝生に覆われ、約1200頭に上る鹿が徘遊する。
sen.e: The most ground in the park is covered with lawn, and up to about 1200 deer are put out to pasture.
sen.cmt: このExcel原稿には「シカが放し飼いされている」と書かれているが、これは事実誤認であり、元のWeb原稿にも書かれているように、鹿はあくまでも「野生」であって、「放し飼い」ではないと思います。
sen.e: The most ground in the park is covered with lawn, and up to about 1200 deer are prowling.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「シカが放し飼いされている」とありましたが、ウェブで確認すると用語が「鹿が徘遊する」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: The most ground in the park is covered with lawn, and up to about 1200 deer are prowling.

sen.j: 彼らは観光客に愛嬌を振りまき、首を縦に振って鹿せんべいをねだる姿が人気を集めている。
sen.e: They are amiable to tourists, and they are gaining popularity by shaking their heads vertically to press tourists for Shika Senbei (baked snack for deer).
They are amiable to tourists, and they are gaining popularity by shaking their heads vertically to press tourists for Shika Senbei (baked snack for deer).
They are amiable to tourists, and they are gaining popularity by shaking their heads vertically to press tourists for Shika Senbei (baked snack for deer).

sen.j: なお、この公園に鹿が放し飼いされていることには以下のような由来がある。
sen.e: By the way, the original reason why the deer are put out to pasture in this park is as follows:
By the way, the original reason why the deer are in this park is as follows:
sen.cmt: 原文には 「鹿が放し飼いされていること」とありましたが、ウェブで確認すると用語が「鹿がいること」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: By the way, the original reason why the deer are in this park is as follows:

sen.j: すなわち、鹿は春日大社の神使であり、春日大社創建の際、茨城県にある鹿島神宮の祭神・武甕槌命が神鹿に乗ってやってきたと伝えられる（春日大社は鹿島含め3社の分霊）。
sen.e: That is to say, it has been handed down to us that a deer is a Shinshi (Divine Servant) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine, and that, when Kasuga-taisha Shrine was founded, Takemikazuchino Mikoto who was the enshrined deity of Kashima-jingu Shrine in Ibaraki Prefecture had come here riding a divine deer (Kasuga-taisha Shrine is a combination of branch shrines for three deities including Kashima).

That is to say, it has been handed down to us that a deer is a Shinshi (Divine Servant) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine, and that, when Kasuga-taisha Shrine was founded, Takemikazuchi no Mikoto who was the enshrined god of Kashima-jingu Shrine in Ibaraki Prefecture had come here riding a divine deer (Kasuga-taisha Shrine is one of the branch shrines for three shrines including Kashima).

That is to say, it has been handed down to us that a deer is a Shinshi (Divine Servant) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine, and that, when Kasuga-taisha Shrine was founded, Takemikazuchi no Mikoto who was the enshrined god of Kashima-jingu Shrine in Ibaraki Prefecture had come here riding a divine deer (Kasuga-taisha Shrine is one of the branch shrines for three shrines including Kashima).

sen.j: それゆえ、奈良公園の鹿は古くから手厚く保護されてきており、不慮の事故も含め、殺めると厳しい刑罰を受けた。
sen.e: Therefore, the deer in Nara Park have been protected very carefully since ancient times, and, including unexpected accidents, when someone killed one of them, he or she received a severe punishment.
Therefore, the deer in Nara Park have been protected very carefully since ancient times, and, including unexpected accidents, when someone killed one of them, he or she received a severe punishment.
Therefore, the deer in Nara Park have been protected very carefully since ancient times, and, including unexpected accidents, when someone killed one of them, he or she received a severe punishment.

sen.j: 伝説によると誤って文鎮で鹿を殺してしまった子供が鹿の死骸とともに生き埋めとなり、その墓が奈良公園周辺に残っている。
sen.e: Legend says that a child who killed a deer with a paperweight by accident was buried alive with a body of the deer, and that the grave still remains around Nara Park.
Legend says that a child who killed a deer with a paperweight by accident was buried alive with a body of the deer, and that the grave still remains around Nara Park.
Legend says that a child who killed a deer with a paperweight by accident was buried alive with a body of the deer, and that the grave still remains around Nara Park.

sen.j: 今でも地元の住民は鹿に愛着の念と共に畏敬の念を併せ持つといわれる。
sen.e: Even today, it is said that the local inhabitants have not only the love for the deer but also the reverence for them simultaneously.
Even today, it is said that the local inhabitants have not only the love for the deer but also the reverence for them simultaneously.
Even today, it is said that the local inhabitants have not only the love for the deer but also the reverence for them simultaneously.

sen.j: この鹿は野生による繁殖で、基本的には餌付けされていない。
sen.e: These deer have been left to wild breeding, and have not gotten accustomed to eat the food given by the men.
These deer have been left to wild breeding, and basically, have not gotten accustomed to be given food.
These deer have been left to wild breeding, and basically, have not gotten accustomed to be given food.

sen.j: その上神格化していたために手厚い保護の下で、個体数を増やしていった。
sen.e: Besides, because they had been deified, they were protected carefully, and they increased in the number of individuals.
Besides, because they had been deified, they were protected carefully, and they increased in the number of individuals.
Besides, because they had been deified, they were protected carefully, and they increased in the number of individuals.

sen.j: しかし、明治維新からは手厚い保護への反発から、戦中から戦後しばらくの間は食糧確保のため狩られ、その結果頭数が二桁まで激減した。
sen.e: But because an antipathy toward careful protection arose after Meiji Restoration, and because it was necessary to secure the food during and for a while after World War II, they were hunted, and as a result the number of the deer decreased markedly to double digits.

But because an antipathy toward careful protection arose after Meiji Restoration, and because it was necessary to secure the food during and for a while after World War II, they were hunted, and as a result the number of the deer decreased markedly to double digits.

But because an antipathy toward careful protection arose after Meiji Restoration, and because it was necessary to secure the food during and for a while after World War II, they were hunted, and as a result the number of the deer decreased markedly to double digits.

sen.j: その後は奈良市が「財団法人 奈良の鹿愛護会」を作り、保護に努め、その結果今日の生息数に至っている。
sen.e: After that, Nara City established "Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park" and has made an effort to protect them, so that they have recovered to the present-day popularity.
After that, Nara City established 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park' and has made an effort to protect them, so that they have recovered to the present-day popularity.
After that, Nara City established 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park' and has made an effort to protect them, so that they have recovered to the present-day popularity.

sen.j: この鹿は野生鹿として国の天然記念物に定められており、故意に傷を付けたり悪戯したりした場合は文化財保護法違反の罪で罰せられる。
sen.e: These deer are designated a Precious Natural Treasure of the State as wild deer, and anyone that hurt them or did them a mischief on purpose will be punished for the violation of the Law of the Protection of Cultural Properties.

These deer are designated a Precious Natural Treasure of the State as wild deer, and anyone that hurt them or did them a mischief on purpose will be punished for the violation of the Law of the Protection of Cultural Properties.

These deer are designated a Precious Natural Treasure of the State as wild deer, and anyone that hurt them or did them a mischief on purpose will be punished for the violation of the Law of the Protection of Cultural Properties.

sen.j: その一方で、近年は観光客が運転する乗用車と鹿の衝突、接触事故が多発しており（鹿の死因のトップにもなっている）、奈良公園界隈の道路では、常に鹿の飛び出しに注意を払う必要がある。
sen.e: But on the other hand, a lot of collision or contact accidents happen between the cars which the tourists drive and the deer in recent years (this is also the top cause of death of the deer), and so, when driving in the neighborhood of Nara Park, drivers must always take care of the deer's leaping out to the road.

But on the other hand, a lot of collision or contact accidents happen between the cars which the tourists drive and the deer in recent years (this is also the top cause of death of the deer), and so, when driving in the neighborhood of Nara Park, drivers must always take care of the deer's leaping out to the road.

But on the other hand, a lot of collision or contact accidents happen between the cars which the tourists drive and the deer in recent years (this is also the top cause of death of the deer), and so, when driving in the neighborhood of Nara Park, drivers must always take care of the deer's leaping out to the road.

sen.j: 「鹿の飛び出し注意」という交通標識まで存在する。
sen.e: There exist even traffic signs that say "Take care of the deer's leaping out to the road."
There exist even traffic signs that say 'Take care of the deer's leaping out to the road.'
There exist even traffic signs that say 'Take care of the deer's leaping out to the road.'

sen.j: 他、最近では、心無い者によって、鹿が危害を加えられる事件も多い。
sen.e: Besides, in these days, there are many cases in which the deer get injured by cruel persons.
Besides, in these days, there are many cases in which the deer get injured by cruel persons.
Besides, in these days, there are many cases in which the deer get injured by cruel persons.

sen.j: 2003年には、鹿がエアガンで打たれる事件があり、また、2008年8月8日には、鹿が漁具の銛で刺されているのが見つかっている。
sen.e: In 2003, a case in which a deer was shot with an air gun happened, and on August 8, 2008, a deer was found to be stabbed with a fishing spear.
In 2003, a case in which a deer was shot with an air gun happened, and on August 8, 2008, a deer was found to be stabbed with a fishing spear.
In 2003, a case in which a deer was shot with an air gun happened, and on August 8, 2008, a deer was found to be stabbed with a fishing spear.

sen.j: また奈良公園では、鹿が道路を横断して交通を妨げたり、付近の家や敷地に入り込む光景がしばしば見られる。
sen.e: Moreover, in Nara Park, the deer are often seen to cross the road and hinder the traffic, or to get into the houses or premises in the neighborhood.
Moreover, in Nara Park, the deer are often seen to cross the road and hinder the traffic, or to get into the houses or premises in the neighborhood.
Moreover, in Nara Park, the deer are often seen to cross the road and hinder the traffic, or to get into the houses or premises in the neighborhood.

sen.j: 遠くは奈良県庁の庭にも、稀に近鉄奈良駅までやってくる事もある。
sen.e: They sometimes come as far as to the garden of Nara Prefectural Government Office, and rarely to Kintetsu Nara Station.
They sometimes come as far as to the garden of Nara Prefectural Government Office, and rarely to Kintetsu Nara Station.
They sometimes come as far as to the garden of Nara Prefectural Government Office, and rarely to Kintetsu Nara Station.

sen.j: 深夜にはかなり遠出もしているようで、JR奈良駅周辺にも出没することがある。
sen.e: They seem to go out fairly far at midnight, and sometimes appear even around JR Nara Station.
They seem to go out fairly far at midnight, and sometimes appear even around JR Nara Station.
They seem to go out fairly far at midnight, and sometimes appear even around JR Nara Station.

sen.j: 過去にはJRの踏切で鹿が電車にはねられたこともあるようだ。
sen.e: It is also said that a deer was hit by a electric train at a crossing of JR in the past.
It is also said that a deer was hit by an electric train at a crossing of JR in the past.
It is also said that a deer was hit by an electric train at a crossing of JR in the past.

sen.j: 奈良の鹿については保護団体である「奈良の鹿愛護会」が毎年調査しており、2008年発表の調査によれば、全1128頭（前年比33頭減）、内オス262頭、メス695頭、仔鹿171頭である（暫定）。
sen.e: The situations of the deer in Nara are investigated every year by their conservation group, "Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park", and according to the investigation published in 2008, there are 1128 deer in total (33 fewer than the previous year), and 262 of them are bucks, 695 does, and 171 fawns (provisional).

The situations of the deer in Nara are investigated every year by their conservation group, 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park,' and according to the investigation published in 2008, there are 1128 deer in total (33 fewer than the previous year), and 262 of them are bucks, 695 does, and 171 fawns (provisional).

The situations of the deer in Nara are investigated every year by their conservation group, 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park,' and according to the investigation published in 2008, there are 1128 deer in total (33 fewer than the previous year), and 262 of them are bucks, 695 does, and 171 fawns (provisional).

sen.j: 死亡原因は疾病174頭、交通事故71頭、犬18頭等となっている。
sen.e: About the causes of death, 174 deer were killed by diseases, 71 deer by traffic accidents, 18 deer by dogs, and so on.
About the causes of death, 174 deer were killed by diseases, 71 deer by traffic accidents, 18 deer by dogs, and so on.
About the causes of death, 174 deer were killed by diseases, 71 deer by traffic accidents, 18 deer by dogs, and so on.

sen.j: 最近では、「奈良の鹿愛護会」の財源不足が深刻であり、観光客に鹿せんべいの購入を積極的に勧めるなどの活動をしているが、根本的な解決には至っていないのが現状となっている。
sen.e: Recently, the shortage of the financial resources of "Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park" has become serious, and so, that group takes some actions like actively urging tourists to buy Shika Senbei, but as the present situation it has never reached to a drastic solution.

Recently, the shortage of the financial resources of 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park' has become serious, and so, that group takes some actions like actively urging tourists to buy Shika Senbei, but as the present situation it has never reached to a drastic solution.

Recently, the shortage of the financial resources of 'Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park' has become serious, and so, that group takes some actions like actively urging tourists to buy Shika Senbei, but as the present situation it has never reached to a drastic solution.

sen.j: 特に観光客が他所の店で買ってきた菓子などを大量に与える例も多く、問題化している。
sen.e: Particularly, there are many cases in which tourists give deer a lot of cookies that they had bought at the stores in the other places, and they have become problems.
Particularly, there are many cases in which tourists give deer a lot of cookies that they had bought at the stores in the other places, which have become problems.
Particularly, there are many cases in which tourists give deer a lot of cookies that they had bought at the stores in the other places, which have become problems.

sen.j: JR奈良駅より三条通りを東へ徒歩15～30分。
sen.e: Walk 15 - 30 minutes through Sanjo-dori Street to the east from JR Nara Station.

sen.j: 又はJR・近鉄の各奈良駅から市内循環バス外回り「氷室神社・国立博物館」・「大仏殿春日大社前」・「春日大社本殿」下車。
sen.e: Or, ride Shinai Junkan (city loop) Bus Sotomawari (outer loop) at JR or Kintetsu Nara Station and get off at "Himuro-jinja, Kokuritsu-Hakubutsukan" (氷室神社・国立博物館), "Daibutsu-den Kasuga-taisha mae" (大仏殿春日大社前), or "Kasuga-taisha Honden" (春日大社本殿).

Or, take the City Loop Bus Sotomawari (outer loop) at JR or Kintetsu Nara Station and get off the bus stops at 'Himuro-jinja, Kokuritsu-Hakubutsukan,' 'Daibutsu-den Kasuga-taisha mae,' or 'Kasuga-taisha Honden.'

Or, take the City Loop Bus Sotomawari (outer loop) at JR or Kintetsu Nara Station and get off the bus stops at 'Himuro-jinja, Kokuritsu-Hakubutsukan,' 'Daibutsu-den Kasuga-taisha mae,' or 'Kasuga-taisha Honden.'

sen.e: Drive 10 km through National Route 24 (for Nara) and National Route 369 from Kizu (木津) Interchange of Keinawa Expressway (京奈和自動車道).

sen.j: フランスの作曲家オリヴィエ・メシアンの作品「7つの俳諧」（1962年）の第2曲には「奈良公園と石灯籠」というタイトルが付けられている。
sen.e: A French composer Olivier MESSIAEN composed "Seven Haikais" (in 1962), and the second music of that work was titled "Nara Park and Lanterns of Stone."
A French composer Olivier MESSIAEN composed 'Seven Haikai' (literally, seven 17-syllable verses, in 1962) of which the second number is titled 'Nara Park and Lanterns of Stone.'
A French composer Olivier MESSIAEN composed 'Seven Haikai' (literally, seven 17-syllable verses, in 1962) of which the second number is titled 'Nara Park and Lanterns of Stone.'

sen.j: この「7つの俳諧」は、メシアンが1962年に来日し奈良をはじめとする日本各地を訪れた折の印象を作品としてまとめたものである。
sen.e: When MESSIAEN came to Japan in 1962, he visited various places in the country including Kyoto, and composed this "Seven Haikais" by combining the impressions of those trips into one work.
When MESSIAEN came to Japan in 1962, he visited various places in the country including Kyoto, and composed this 'Seven Haikai' by combining the impressions of those trips into one work.
When MESSIAEN came to Japan in 1962, he visited various places in the country including Kyoto, and composed this 'Seven Haikai' by combining the impressions of those trips into one work.
